title: Lordsilvabtc
author: Lordsilvabtc
content: I've read up content and informations on this platform and found out, one of the greatest offense is plagiarism. First just Incase you're new to the platform and have no idea what Plagiarism is. " It's simply an act of copying someone's ideas, or write up, or any other creative working idea, thereby presenting them as yours, without permission or a link to where such information was gotten from or posted.Most newbies does this a lot in other to rank up in the platform and earn merit, Which is not the original idea of the platform, hence this results to their account being banned.My advice to fellow newbies is this, If you have to copy someone's ideas for any reason, that's if the reason is good enough, Include a link where you got such information from, by so doing, You will get a good reputation from the platform and stay banned free, even if you're not merited, Your account will go on to survive.Also don't stop researching. Follow rules and guidelines. This is the only way to substained your presences in the platform. thank you.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: This is your second topic today with advice on how not to get banned. Why? It's great to have shitposters banned, the decent posters usually figure out the rules on their own.

comments.author: Ryker1
comments.body: Well I am happy to see if you will apply this yourself. It is very simple, do not interact with the topic or don't create a topic that you do not know, be a genuine poster here in the forum so that you can avoid copy-pasting offense. As a newbie --it is good if you will read a lot more than posting a topic like this that already existed.No offense but plagiarism is everywhere on the platform's rules and is strictly prohibited, we all know this.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: It is important to know this especially early on in one’s newbie days. You won’t be making such mistakes as you are well aware of the consequences. It will be a shame to have built a solid account and good reputation only to have plagiarized articles being discovered on your account. The price for plagiarism is a big one to pay, though I read the mods judge based on case by case basis, you can find some ban appeal threads of banned users on Meta.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Lordsilvabtc, i see that you reported all the topics you started in a short span in Fillippone's topic here, there is nothing bad doing that, but i don't know if you think any post reported there must be merited, and so you are starting so many similar topics; it is not so because Fillippone will check all the posts to make sure they are good posts before sending out merits, so 1 good post is better than >1 similar/bad posts.Your new topics may not be so bad but they are similar, this is similar to this, and this is also similar to this one, and the duplicate topics could have been discussed to a great extent in the original one, without the need of creating a new topic.Take this as a positive criticism, you would not want to do things that can make people ignore your account. Cheers bruh.

comments.body: This is no longer a new information on this forum because the act plagiarism is an offence that any sound person ought to be aware of, to Op, you seem very familiar with the topic you created I hope you will also not be found committing the offense because most times newbies try to play smart by coping the entire work of another member here to attract attention and merit without referencing the original poster or giving links to the source of their information. Back in the college the word plagiarism was explained and it was also frowned upon so anyone who is found committing the offense did not start it today the idea of stealing and cheating has been with such person.

Once again thanks for the amazing lessons so far, I really do appreciate. Thank you I understand that you want to prove yourself as a newbie but having a similar post all over within a short interval is where you get it wrong. It's okay to ask questions or give suggestions on what newbies should avoid doing before proving your points to newbies that are in the forumYou don't need to create a new post now and then before your message gets to newbies. This forum is not circled advising only newbies.
